title: How Does Spell Vamp Work in League of Legends?
body:
I've been playing League of Legends for a while now and I never got a chance to understand what is spell vamp. I see that Morganna's passive has spell vamp but I don't know what it really does, any help would be appreciated.

P.S: Someone told me that spell vamp is like lifesteal but except it's ap. Is this correct?

replies.body: It's something you get on Darius for the sick ult spell vamp plays.

If it has a cooldown it typically applies spellvamp.  
So all the usual abilities proc it, Cho'Gaths Vorpal Spikes proc it but Teemos Toxic Shot does not.   
Spellvamp is proc'd in full effect on single target abilities and proc'd at 33% of its usual effectiveness on AoE abilities. For example, Swain's Q and E proc the full effect but his W and Ult only proc 33% of spellvamp(20% SV becomes 6.6% SV).  
If an ability applies 'On-Hit Effects'(meaning Lifesteal, Crit and/or redbuff etc) then it will NOT apply spellvamp.  
  
Due to it's reduced effectiveness on AoE abilities, it is rarely built.  
The few champions that can effectively build SpellVamp are Akali, Cassiopeia, Kennen, Mordekaiser, Morgana and Vladimir.  
A few champions used to be rather effective with SpellVamp but have since shifted to a more powerful build path that has no need for it, these include: Ahri, Fiddlesticks, Kat and Ryze.

Actually DoT spells (providing they are not also AoE or multi target spells like fiddle's E) fully proc spellvamp, swains Q and E fully apply it, the same with Malzahars E and R and mordekaisers R ect. ect.
Spell Vamp heals for Q,W,E,R and certain actives, Life Steal applies to all Auto Attacks

Not all Qs Es Ws and Rs apply spellvemp though
Nasus's Q Miss fortune's Q and Ezreal's Q to name a few
Any abilities that apply on-hits benefit from lifesteal instead of spellvamp. So, when/if the Evelynn changes go through and her E applies on-hits, she'll no longer get spellvamp from it.
Yea exactly, i was just saying that not all Q,W,E,R spells apply it.
It heals you for a % of the damage done by your spells.
Yep it is basically life steal for spells, but reduced to 1/3 effectiveness with AoE spells but apart from that it just takes a percentage of the damage dealt and returns it as HP to you
tl;dr It's like having life steal but for AP champions.
